column4: Hello, I was wondering if anyone knows about installing WindowsXP on a separate partition (after ubuntu is already the primary (and only) installed OS) and then being able to run it with something like VirtualBox?
virtualbox doesn't reuire a separate partition , windows installs inside VB
using VB is redundant if you intend to install XP on another HDD
it is? It seems to me that being able to access another OS from my Ubuntu host would be an advantage (no rebooting just to do one little thing)
you can access windows from inside ubuntu , using  the ntfs volume in nautilus

if what i wanted was to access files I wouldn't bother with ntfs systems. My problem is that I'm in a class that requires me to use windows-only CAD software... and i do not want to ditch ubuntu for a quarter just because I have to use SolidWorks
